page.title: 01A Corner OF The Garioch
page.content: Essentially composed of a river valley flanked on both sides by low undulating hills, the area is primarily used for agriculture. The valley floor is used for dairying and there are three dairy farms situated within the area, supplying the nearby busy town of Inverurie. Cereals & fodder crops are grown extensively with only the steepest tops of the hills given over to rough grazing. As rich in history as is in agriculture, old and new co-exist with mutual respect. Great standing stones are left undisturbed in the midst of the intensively cultivated fields, the castle ruins of Balquhuin watch, as they have done for over 400 years, over ever changing farming methods, and the great monument of Harlow is sentinel over the now peaceful battleground grazed quietly
